ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

REF AD2.22.5.1.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK : READ : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI AND API ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. INSTEAD OF : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT.'

THE CHAPTER 22.2.3 IS UPDATED ACCORDINGLY: 22.2.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK ORLY AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME AND ESTIMED LANDING TIME, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN-ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DIFFERENT TYPES OF DPI AND API ARE: -GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) -PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (P-DPI) -EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) -TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) -ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) -CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER TO BE USED REA AS IT IS REPLACED BY DPI MESSSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. REF AIP AD2 22.2.3

NOT LOGON LISTED ACFT SHALL NOT TRY TO LOGON TO EDUU. LOGON FORWARDING FOR NOT LOGON LISTED ACFT WILL NOT BE PERFORMED. SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.

AX0006/24 AIC RESTRICTION EHAA/AMSTERDAM FIR VALIDITY: 25JUL24 - UFN USE OF 3.4 - 3.8 GHZ BAND FOR 5G NETWORKS IN THE AMSTERDAM FIR. OPERATORS ARE ENCOURAGED TO FOLLOW ANY RECOMMENDATIONS COMING FROM EASA AND THEIR ACFT OR RADIO ALTIMETER MANUFACTURERS ON THE SUBJECT. PILOTS WHO EXPERIENCE RADIO ALTIMETER ANOMALIES SHOULD INFORM AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL AS SOON AS PRACTICALLY POSSIBLE TO ALLOW APPROPRIATE OPERATIONAL MEASURES TO BE TAKEN WHEN NECESSARY.

FOR OVERFLIGHTS OR ARRIVALS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED BY THE PILOT, WITH SUFFICIENT NOTICE (BETWEEN 10 AND 25 MINUTES BEFORE ENTERING THE CRNA), TO ENSURE THAT THE CONNECTION IS ESTABLISHED, AND WITH THE FIRST FRENCH ACC CROSSED. IF LOGON HAS ALREADY BEEN ESTABLISHED WITH AN ADJACENT UPSTREAM ACC PROVIDING LOGON FORWARD, OR IF FORWARD HAS FAILED, ADVANCE NOTICE IS NOT REQUIRED. FOR FLIGHTS DEPARTING FROM FRENCH AIRFIELDS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED NO LATER THAN CROSSING FL150. IF LOGON IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A TECHNICAL REASON KNOWN OR UNKNOWN TO THE E PILOT, THE CREW WILL ANNOUNCE 'UNABLE CPDLC'. REFERENCE AIP FRANCE GEN 3.4-9.

Paragraph.Text: AX0002/20 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR THE PILOT OF THE AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN THE LIBYAN AIR SPACE A. THE LIBYAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY STRESSES THE PILOT OF AIRCRAFT OPERATING OUTSIDE THE FIELD OF HIGH COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE NECESSITY OF USING VHF/ RT RANGE .RADIO FREQUENCY ASSIGNED TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION BETWEEN PILOTS VHF AIR / AIR VOLINTARY REPORT. B. FOR MORE COORDINATION BETWEEN THE OPPOSING AIR TRAFFIC, ESPECIALLY THOSE OPERATING OUTSIDE THE CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION IN THE LIBYAN AVIATION TERRITORY AND THE MENTIONED RADIO FREQUENCIES ARE: 1- WHEN FLYING AT OR BELOW THE FLYING LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 123.5 MHZ 2- WHEN FLYING ABOVE A FLIGHT LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 126.9 MHZ C. THIS AUTHORITY ALSO STRESSES THE NEED TO OBTAIN PRIOR PERMISSION FOR FLIGHTS BEFORE TAKING OFF FROM AIRPORTS THAT ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THE MAJOR AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL CENTERS IN TRIPOLI AND ITS BRANCH IN BENGHAZI BY WAY OF HIGH-FREQUENCY RADIO
